item.title: Power Control Unit Monitor System (Including Pressure Differential Sensors)

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided Power Control Unit Actuators are verified to be operative by performing a single hydraulic system flight controls check with each hydraulic system before each departure.

placard.para: Placard near EICAS "POWER CONTROL UNIT MONITOR INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Before each departure, perform a single hydraulic flight controls check with each of the three hydraulic systems as follows:

warning.para: ENSURE PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL CONTROL SURFACES TO PREVENT INJURY OR DAMAGE.

numlitem.para: Supply pressure to Left, Right and Center hydraulic systems.
Observe Center Electric Pump PRESS light(s) extinguished.

note.para: If the aircraft is using only the APU or ground power, there is no power to the number 2 pump therefore the number 1 center electric pump will come on and only the PRESS light for the number 1 pump will extinguish.

numlitem.para: Rudder check: Displace rudder in both directions while observing rudder deflection on EICAS status display. Verify movement in proper direction, and that deflection rate is normal (rate is non-normal if control surface deflection lags significantly behind pilot input).

note.para: Hold the nose wheel steering tiller stationary during rudder check to prevent nose wheel movement.

numlitem.para: Elevator check: Set the stabilizer to 7 units. Displace control column forward and aft while observing elevator deflection on EICAS status display. Control column sweep should be accomplished at a rate of 8-12 seconds for a full column sweep (from neutral to full nose up to full nose down to neutral). Verify movement in proper direction, and that deflection rate is normal (rate is non-normal if control surface deflection lags significantly behind pilot input). Also verify that both elevators track the column input and that there is no significant disagreement between the two surfaces. Ensure that each surface returns to neutral position when the column is returned to neutral.

note.para: The SPOILERS light and message may illuminate if the control wheel is displaced with only the center system hydraulics available. The light will extinguish after the left and right hydraulic systems are powered.

numlitem.para: Left ENG or Left ELEC Pump Switch..........................ON
Observe appropriate Left Pump PRESS light extinguished.
Left ENG and Left ELEC Pump Switches...................OFF
Right ENG or Right ELEC Pump Switch....................ON
Observe appropriate Right Pump PRESS light extinguished.
Restore HYDRAULIC PANEL Pump Switch setting as required and observe Pump PRESS lights are as appropriate.
Reset stabilizer to takeoff trim setting, as required.
